body.name: Galanz 0.9 Cu. Ft Air Fry Microwave Stainless Steel
body.description: Ultimate Cooking Versatility: The multifunctional air fryer, convection oven and microwave that features Combi Speed cooking in one device for 3 Appliances in 1. Air Fry Technology： Air fry with little or no oil for healthier, crunchy fried favorites like chicken, shrimp, wings, and French fries. The easy-clean air fry kit provides more frying surface area with better air circulation compared to traditional air fryers. Air frying does not use microwaves but uses the built-in heating elements. Combi Speed Cooking Faster than either mode alone, the intelligent combination of True Convection and microwave cooking creates delicious dishes with optimum texture and taste. Roast chicken, baked potatoes and frozen entrees can now be ready when you are. True Convection Heated air circulates throughout the oven as food spins 360°, cooking your food faster and more evenly without hot spots. You can even broil and bake foods with direct heat, such as fish, chicken and fresh, oven-baked goods. Auto-Cook and Auto-Reheat 6 cooking programs and 8 reheating program for convenient and easy use. Thoughtful Control Panel with quick touch buttons Control Panel is designed for easy use and allows you to start cooking faster

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love, love, love it!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: What a space saver. It microwaves, bakes, and airfryer all in one unit. It is easy to use and is so quiet. I just love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I love the features, especially the air fry. I bought this for my work office and so far it has not disappointed. It was very well packaged for delivery. It fits perfectly on top of my mini fridge. The air fry pans are non-stick and clean very eaily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Love the fact that you can microwave, bake & airfry all in one place. I haven't used my stove oven in over a month. I bought another one so I can do more & have everything done at the same time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Had door issues
reviews.reviewText: It wouldnt work properly at first, light stayed on, turntable kept turning even when nothing was cooking. wouldnt start... Messed with the door alittle and works just fine now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is an absolute unit
reviews.reviewText: I freed up quite a bit of space in my modest kitchen and my neighbors got a free microwave and toaster oven.All of the features work as advertised, the build quality is solid, lots of stainless steel and not much plastic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I brought this for my daughter for her dorm room. It is great because I know she can fix a combination of different things!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Pops 20A circuit breaker frequently
reviews.reviewText: I bought this from a big-box store, not Amazon, so this isn't gonna count as a "Verified Purchase, but whatever. You still need to know what I experienced with it.It performs the expected features of a microwave, and the air fryer attachment works halfway-decently, but (as I stated in the title) it draws far more power than it should. A microwave of this size is typically fine on a dedicated 15A circuit; the manual for this one insists on a 20A dedicated circuit - and even with that, it still manages to pop my circuit breaker about once every fifty uses (so probably about every month or so on average). Its AC power draw in microwave (i.e. non-convection) mode is allegedly 1350W, which works out to just over 12A, and yet it's popping a 20A breaker?! I probably should have returned it, but the first pop didn't happen until the second month, and I figured it was a fluke.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great combination appliance.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Saves space in my small kitchen.
